item.title: [Delta]A Better Castle Wars Base
item.dc:creator: @Xx_MrTuck_xX Xx MrTuck xX
item.description:
@Xx_MrTuck_xX wrote:

very nice.

also for pickSideForMe() in Castlewars you could make it like this.

	private void pickSideForMe() {
		Random rand = new Random();
		int Random = rand.nextInt(2);
		if (playersInZamorak.size() == playersInSaradomin.size())
			switch(Random){
				case 1:
					joinZamorak();
				break;
				case 2:
					joinSaradomin();
				break;				
			}
		if (playersInZamorak.size() < playersInSaradomin.size())
			joinZamorak();
		else
			joinSaradomin();

	}

and add this under import.

import java.util.Random;

anyway once the game ends it kicks everyone off the server, and spams this in cmd.

java.lang.NullPointerException
        at CastleWarsHandler.process(CastleWarsHandler.java:20)
        at process.run(process.java:25)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta]A Better Castle Wars Base
item.dc:creator: @SlyScim SlyScim
item.description:
@SlyScim wrote:

Everything works flawlessly with the portals for me, no errors in my cmd. However, I am getting the same “time remaining : 1” issue as everybody else. Even when I change the # of players to start to > 0, I still can’t actually start a match of Castle Wars. I’ll look into this more, but if there’s a known fix then please let me know.

Otherwise, this is a flawless minigame, and thank you so much for the coding!

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta]A Better Castle Wars Base
item.dc:creator: @lokator lokator
item.description:
@lokator wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:91, topic:366050”]CastleWar.java:8: class CastleWars is public, should be declared in a file named CastleWars.java

You didn’t save it as CastleWars.java, you saved it as CastleWar.java. You’re missing the ‘s’.[/quote]

Thanks

Edit: Hey now when I try to conetct to my server it crach and say Connection lost Please wait - attemting to reastablish What to do

item.title: [Delta]A Better Castle Wars Base
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

CastleWar.java:8: class CastleWars is public, should be declared in a file named CastleWars.java

You didn’t save it as CastleWars.java, you saved it as CastleWar.java. You’re missing the ‘s’.
